Query param type validation gaps: Not all invalid/malformed query param types are tested (e.g., invalid boolean values for withPluginInfo/includedDeleted, excessively long pluginProperty strings, duplicate pluginProperty handling edge-cases).
Response headers & content-type: Tests do not check Content-Type, charset, or other HTTP headers required by the contract.
Pagination-related performance and partial-results behavior: TC14 checks total response time but does not verify behavior under streaming, pagination, or server-imposed max limits.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: If the API supports/limits results, add tests for page size, offsets/markers, first/next links, and behavior when requesting beyond available pages. Include a test for very large result sets that ensures either pagination or a documented max page size is respected.

Add caching tests: Validate ETag and Cache-Control headers, and conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match returning 304). Also assert correct Cache-Control and other relevant headers for clients/proxies.
Add rate limiting tests: Simulate bursts of requests to verify 429 responses and Retry-After headers; include both short-term burst and sustained high-rate scenarios.
Expand authorization tests: Add scenarios for expired tokens, invalid tokens, insufficient permissions (403), and token-scoped access differences if applicable.
Add schema validation tests: Assert precise JSON schema for PaymentMethod objects (field presence, types, formats) and verify error payload schema for 4xx/5xx responses.

Broaden query-parameter validation: Test invalid boolean values (e.g., withPluginInfo=notABool), very long pluginProperty values, a large number of pluginProperty entries, and duplicate pluginProperty entries to verify deterministic behavior.
Verify response headers and content-type: Add assertions for Content-Type: application/json, charset, and any required custom headers.

Add negative and boundary performance tests: Besides the single large-set TC14, include stress/load tests and response-time SLAs under realistic load; verify graceful degradation when limits are reached.

Clarify and test audit parameter behavior: Add explicit tests for audit=NONE (default), and verify how missing/omitted audit param differs from audit=NONE, as well as invalid enum values beyond the one tested.
If applicable, test backward compatibility more precisely: Include consumer contract tests that assert exact previously-documented field shapes/ordering where consumers rely on them.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Remove tags from bundle

covered: Valid Deletion: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC12, TC16, TC17) verify successful removal and 204 responses.
Empty Response / Idempotency: TC04 and TC16 cover behavior when bundle has no tags or tagDef empty array (idempotent delete).
Query Parameter Validation: TC02, TC07, TC13 cover valid tagDef usage and invalid tagDef formats; TC11 checks unexpected extra query params are ignored.
Path Parameter Validation: TC05 validates invalid bundleId format; TC06 covers non-existent bundleId (404).
Header Validation: TC03 verifies use of X-Killbill-Reason / Comment; TC08 covers missing required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header.
Authorization / Auth Errors: TC09 covers unauthorized access handling.
Service Availability Errors: TC10 covers service-unavailable (503) behavior.
Concurrency / Race Conditions: TC15 tests concurrent DELETE requests and checks for data corruption.
Performance / Scale Cases: TC12 and TC18 cover large numbers of tag deletions and potential timeout behavior.
Security / Injection: TC14 addresses XSS/SQL injection in headers.
Integration / Data Consistency: TC17 verifies post-delete state via GET (end-to-end consistency).
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior — note: pagination is typically GET-specific and may not apply to this DELETE endpoint.
Caching & Response Headers: No tests assert response headers (Content-Type, Cache-Control, ETag) or caching behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limits (429) or throttle behavior under sustained load beyond TC15 concurrency scenario.
Server Error Handling (5xx): No explicit tests for 500/Internal Server Error / DB failure scenarios beyond 503.
Soft Delete / Persistence Model: No tests verifying whether deletion is soft (flagged) vs hard (removed) in persistence or audit records.
Audit / Provenance: Although headers are sent, there are no tests verifying that X-Killbill-CreatedBy, X-Killbill-Reason, X-Killbill-Comment are recorded in audit logs or DB.
Partial non-existent tagDefs: Missing test for behavior when some provided tagDef UUIDs are well-formed but not associated with the bundle (should it succeed and ignore, or return an error?).
Authorization nuance (403 vs 401): Tests cover "unauthorized" (401) but not authorization/permission scenarios that should return 403.
Repeated / Idempotent Calls: No explicit test that repeated DELETE calls after tags already removed still return expected response consistently (beyond TC04 implicit case).
Input encoding & malformed query encoding: No tests for URL-encoded tagDef values or malformed query string edge cases.
recommendations: Add tests asserting response headers (Content-Type, Cache-Control, ETag) to validate API contract and caching behavior.
Add server-failure (500) simulation tests (e.g., DB failure) to verify graceful error handling and consistent error payloads.
Add tests for rate limiting / throttling (429 responses) and sustained high-load behaviour beyond single concurrency test.
Add tests to verify audit/logging: confirm X-Killbill-CreatedBy / Reason / Comment are persisted to audit tables or returned via an audit endpoint.
Add a scenario for mixed tagDef inputs where some UUIDs are valid-but-not-associated to confirm expected behavior (partial success vs error).
Add explicit idempotency test: multiple sequential DELETE calls and verification of consistent 204 responses (and no side-effects).
Add authorization role tests that differentiate 401 (not authenticated) from 403 (authenticated but forbidden) where applicable.
Add a soft-delete vs hard-delete verification (via DB or GET) to ensure the persistence model meets expectations.
Add tests for URL-encoded and malformed query parameters to validate parsing and error reporting.
Document and, if applicable, remove/mark as N/A any guideline items that don’t apply to this DELETE endpoint (e.g., pagination) to avoid false negatives in coverage metrics.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Retrieve account invoice payments

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC05, TC06, etc.) verify successful 200 responses and inclusion/omission of optional data (pluginInfo, attempts, audit).
Empty Response: TC07 and TC17 cover accounts with no invoice payments returning an empty JSON array.
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for query params withPluginInfo, withAttempts, pluginProperty, audit, combinations (TC02–TC06, TC12–TC14, TC19).
Authorization: TC10 checks missing/invalid authentication returning 401.
Error Handling / Resource Not Found / Bad Request: TC08 (400 malformed UUID), TC09 (404 not found), TC12 (invalid audit value) cover main error cases.
Security Validation: SQL injection and XSS are tested (TC23, TC24).
Integration / Dependent Service Failures: TC18 covers plugin/attempt service unavailability (503 or partial data).
Performance: TC15, TC21, TC22 address large dataset and response time under normal/peak load.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit tests for pagination parameters (page, offset, limit) or pagination links; TC15 mentions possible pagination but does not validate pagination behavior or correctness.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests verify behavior under high request rates (429 responses, backoff behavior, retry-after header).
Caching Behavior / Conditional GET: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Authorization - fine-grained access: No test for authenticated-but-forbidden (403) scenarios or role/permission-based access control.

Response Schema Strictness: While required fields are asserted generically, there are no explicit tests validating full schema (field types, formats, nullable vs required, numeric ranges) for InvoicePayment objects.

Server Error Coverage: Limited 5xx coverage — TC18 covers dependent service 503, but there are no tests that explicitly simulate internal server errors (500) such as DB failures or unhandled exceptions.
Pagination / Large Result Consistency: No tests that validate consistency across paginated responses (no duplicates/missing records across pages) or stable ordering.
Rate-limit/retry interaction with idempotency: No tests for client retry behavior resulting from transient failures (beyond TC25 generic retry case) and no rate-limit + retry interplay.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: verify limit/offset or page/size parameters, validate link headers or paging tokens, ensure consistent ordering and no duplicates across pages.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate burst traffic to confirm 429 responses, Retry-After header, and proper client/backoff handling.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match returns 304 and that responses change when underlying data changes.
Add authorization matrix tests: include authenticated-but-forbidden (403) scenarios and role-based access cases if applicable.
Add strict schema validation tests: assert field types, required vs optional fields, UUID formats for IDs, date/time formats and numeric ranges for amounts.
Add server error simulations: test 500 Internal Server Error scenarios (e.g., DB failure) and verify appropriate error payload and logging/monitoring hooks.
Add detailed pluginProperty validation tests: malformed encodings, unsupported formats, and behavior when duplicate pluginProperty keys are provided.
Enhance recovery and retry tests: combine transient network failures with rate limiting and ensure idempotent behavior, and verify client retry results (TC25 expanded).
If applicable, add tests for caching + authorization interactions (private vs public cache headers) and for header-based behavior (Accept, Content-Type).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/pagination - List accounts

covered: Valid Request: Numerous success scenarios validate default behavior and combinations of query parameters (offset, limit, accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit).
Empty Response: Tests cover empty database and offset beyond available data producing empty arrays.

Pagination: Basic pagination behaviors covered including default limit, offset+limit boundary conditions, large-volume retrieval, limit > total accounts, offset=0, and maximum/minimum value edge cases.
Query Parameters: Extensive positive and negative parameter tests (valid combinations, malformed integers/booleans, unsupported params ignored, SQLi/XSS attempts).
Authorization: Authentication success and failure are tested (401 for missing/invalid credentials).
Error Handling: Client-side validation errors covered (400 for invalid offset/limit/audit), server-side unavailability tested (503), timeouts and dependency failures included.
Performance & Concurrency: Scenarios exist for large dataset performance, concurrent requests, degraded performance, and recovery from transient errors.
Integration: Dependency failure and consistency checks with audit/balance services are present.
HTTP contract: Method-not-allowed case (405 for POST) and content being JSON are asserted in multiple scenarios.
Security: SQL injection and XSS parameter tests included.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios validate rate-limiting behavior or throttling under many requests in a short time (429 handling).
Caching Behavior / Headers: No tests assert presence or correctness of caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or behavior when client provides If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since.
Authorization granularity (403): Tests cover missing/invalid auth (401) but there are no scenarios for authenticated-but-forbidden (403) cases or role/permission checks.
Content-Type & Accept headers: No explicit assertions on response Content-Type header or behavior for different Accept header values (content negotiation).

Server Error (500) and unexpected failures: While service-unavailable (503) is covered, there are no explicit tests for generic server errors (500) such as database failure resulting in 500 responses and how they are surfaced.

Strict response schema / field types: Tests assert presence/absence of fields but do not validate full JSON schema, exact field types, field formats (e.g., int64 constraints), or additional/unknown fields in Account objects.
Rate-limit + concurrency interaction: Concurrency tests exist but do not combine with rate-limiting conditions to validate degradation/429s and backoff behavior.
Cache invalidation and stale data: No tests for correctness when underlying data changes between requests (ETag validation, cache revalidation).
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many rapid requests to confirm proper throttling behavior (429) and that clients receive Retry-After headers where applicable.
Add caching/header tests: assert Content-Type is application/json, verify Cache-Control and ETag existence and semantics, and test conditional GETs (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Add authorization/permission tests (403): create scenarios for authenticated users without sufficient permissions and verify 403 responses.
Add server-error tests (500): simulate DB or unexpected server failures to ensure consistent 5xx responses and safe error messages.
Enhance schema validation: add tests that validate the full Account JSON schema (field names, types, numeric ranges/int64 handling, and absence of unexpected fields).
Combine concurrency and rate-limit tests: validate system behavior when concurrent clients hit rate limits and that responses remain consistent.
Add content negotiation tests: verify behavior with different Accept headers and that Content-Type is returned correctly.
Add cache-invalidation / fresh data tests: verify that changes in account data are reflected appropriately and caches are invalidated or revalidated.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered: Valid Request: Core successful flows are covered (basic refresh, pluginName, single and multiple pluginProperty values).
Required Headers: Presence and absence of X-Killbill-CreatedBy are tested (TC01, TC05, TC10).
Path Parameter Validation: UUID format validation and invalid-format handling are covered (TC08).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 handling for missing account is covered (TC09, TC27).
Optional Headers: X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment use is covered (TC05).
Plugin behavior and failures: Supported/unsupported plugin handling and plugin service/unavailable gateway cases are covered (TC02, TC11, TC13, TC25).
No-payment-methods state: Behavior when account has no payment methods is covered (TC06).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempt tests exist (TC16, TC17).

Edge cases: Extra unexpected params, very large accountId, timeout, malformed pluginProperty, large pluginProperty payloads, and malformed/multiple values are covered (TC18, TC19, TC20, TC12, TC24, TC07).
Concurrency & Performance: Concurrency and performance related scenarios are present (TC23, TC14, TC29).
Regression/Compatibility: Encoding, backward compatibility, and data consistency checks are present (TC21, TC22, TC26).
gaps: Produces / Content-Type: No explicit assertions that responses (errors or success) include the stated "application/json" Content-Type or handle 204 semantics consistently (204 with or without body).

Precise required-header behavior: TC10 allows 400 or 401 — the acceptance criteria require X-Killbill-CreatedBy required; tests should assert the exact expected status and error structure rather than an OR.
Request body presence: There is no test for behavior when a request body is supplied to an endpoint that expects no body (should be validated/rejected or ignored).
Error response schema: Tests do not validate the structure/fields of error responses (JSON schema, error codes/messages).
HTTP method validation: No tests for other HTTP verbs (e.g., POST/GET/DELETE) returning 405 or appropriate behaviour.
Rate limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limit handling (429) or behavior under burst requests beyond generic concurrency/performance scenarios.
Caching / Headers: No tests for caching headers, ETag, Cache-Control (if applicable) or validation of cache semantics.
Header value validation: No tests for blank/too-long X-Killbill-CreatedBy, X-Killbill-Reason, X-Killbill-Comment values or invalid character handling.
Idempotency / Side-effects: No explicit tests asserting idempotency of refresh or the exact side-effects on payment-method records (beyond “refreshed” status).
Response time assertions lack concrete thresholds: Several performance scenarios state “acceptable threshold” but do not define or assert concrete timing thresholds.
recommendations: Add assertions for response Content-Type and body semantics: validate Content-Type for error responses and clarify handling of 204 (empty body) vs. application/json.
Tighten required-header tests: replace “400 or 401” with the exact expected status and validate the error message/JSON fields for missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
Test request-body handling: add a test that sends a non-empty body with the PUT to verify whether it is ignored or rejected and assert the expected status/schema.
Validate error response schema: add JSON schema checks for error responses (code, message, type) across 4xx/5xx scenarios.
Add method validation tests: attempt POST/GET/DELETE on the same path and assert 405 (or documented behavior).
Add rate-limiting / throttling tests: simulate burst traffic and assert 429 or documented throttling behavior and recovery.
Add caching/header tests if applicable: check for ETag/Cache-Control or other headers if the system documents them or if intermediate caches are used.
Add header value edge-case tests: blank, overly long, or illegal characters in X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment and assert expected validation errors.

Add explicit idempotency and side-effect assertions: verify payment-method records before/after refresh in detail (which fields change, timestamps, versioning) and test repeated refreshes for idempotency.
Define and assert concrete performance thresholds: convert “acceptable threshold” into numeric timeouts in tests and use them for CI performance checks.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered: Valid Payload: Happy path (TC01) and multiple variants (TC02, TC05) validate successful creation and expected 201 responses.
Invalid Payload / Validation: Malformed JSON (TC08), missing required CustomField properties (TC16), extra unexpected fields (TC06), and SQL/XSS payloads (TC14) are covered.
Resource existence & path validation: Invalid UUID format (TC10) and non-existent paymentId (TC11) are covered.
Authorization & Authentication: Missing/invalid auth token is covered (TC12); required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy presence is covered (TC09).
Optional headers: Handling of X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment is covered (TC02).
Empty/edge payloads: Empty array case is considered (TC07).
Large payload / Stress: Very large payload near limit covered (TC15); performance under normal and peak load covered (TC22, TC23).
Concurrency / Duplicate concerns: Concurrent writes are tested (TC19). Duplicate field-name regression is included (TC20).
Error conditions & resilience: Dependent service downtime (TC13) and network timeouts (TC18) are included.
Integration & persistence: Post-create retrieval and cross-system consistency are covered (TC24, TC25).
Unicode / encoding: Unicode payloads are covered (TC21).
Regression and accessibility: Regression checks and API documentation accessibility are included (TC20, TC26).
gaps: Duplicate submission idempotency: No explicit test for repeated identical POST requests to verify idempotency or deduplication semantics (distinct from duplicate field names).
Server 5xx general error handling: There is a test for service unavailable (503) but no explicit coverage for generic 500 errors or DB integrity constraint failures.
Authorization scopes / Forbidden (403): Tests cover missing/invalid auth (401) but not authorized-but-forbidden scenarios (403) for insufficient permissions/roles.
Content-Type / request headers robustness: Missing or incorrect Content-Type handling is not covered (Background assumes application/json).
Precise schema validation & field constraints: Tests do not assert detailed field-level validation (e.g., max length, allowed characters, data types/enum constraints for each CustomField property).
Idempotency / duplicate request window & dedup keys: No tests for client-supplied idempotency keys or server-side duplicate request protection.
Response headers and metadata: No assertions for response headers (Content-Type, Location, ETag), timestamps, createdBy/createdDate fields in response.
Rate limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting or behavior under throttled requests.
Caching behavior: Not applicable for POST generally, but no tests for related side-effects (e.g., cache invalidation) or headers on responses.
Ambiguity in optional-case outcomes: Several scenarios accept either 201 or 400 depending on "API design" (TC06, TC07, TC17, TC20). These should be deterministic per spec and tested accordingly.
recommendations: Add an idempotency / duplicate-submission test: repeat the same POST twice (with/without idempotency key) and assert expected behavior (no duplicate resources or clear dedup semantics).
Add a generic 500-server-error simulation: force DB constraint or server exception to validate 500 handling and error response shape.
Add authorization role tests: include cases where the token is valid but lacks permissions (expect 403) to cover permission boundaries.
Test Content-Type handling: include scenarios with missing or wrong Content-Type header and assert 415/400 behavior per API spec.

Expand schema validation tests: add tests for field-level constraints (max length, allowed characters, required objectType values) and explicit assertions for response fields createdBy/createdDate IDs.

Make ambiguous scenarios deterministic: replace “201 or 400 depending on API design” with expected behavior derived from the API contract, and add both positive and negative tests if the contract allows variability.
Add response header assertions: validate Content-Type, and, if applicable, Location/ETag/Cache-Control presence or absence.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many rapid requests and assert 429 or configured throttling behavior; also add retry/backoff guidance tests.
Add cache-invalidation/integration touches if surrounding systems use caching: verify GET after POST returns fresh data and caches (if relevant).
Add tests for id / value boundary cases and schema edge-cases: extremely long fieldName/fieldValue, nulls in optional fields, and binary/unexpected encodings to ensure robustness.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/simplePlan - Add a simple plan entry in the current version of the catalog

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC12, TC13, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC23) validate successful creation with different payloads (unique IDs, optional headers, max/min lengths, empty/partial catalog states).
Invalid Payload & Validation: Missing fields, invalid currency, malformed JSON, empty body, and malicious inputs are covered (TC04, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC18).
Required/Optional Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header and optional X-Killbill-Reason/X-Killbill-Comment headers are exercised (TC01, TC02, TC03).
Duplicate/Conflict Handling: Duplicate planId conflict is tested (TC06).
Large Payload Handling: Very large payloads are covered (TC15) to check system limits.
Authentication/Authorization: Missing authentication is covered (TC10) to validate 401 handling.
Service Availability & Integration: Catalog unavailable and dependent services degraded/available covered (TC11, TC23, TC24).
Concurrency & Race Conditions: Concurrent creation requests are covered (TC22).
Error Modes & Retry: Network failure and retry behavior covered (TC16).
Unsupported Method Handling: Using GET on the POST endpoint tested for 405 (TC14).
Performance: A basic response-time SLA test is included (TC17).
gaps: Server-side 5xx Error Handling: No explicit scenario that simulates internal server/database failures producing HTTP 500 and verifies graceful error handling and retries. (POST guideline: Server Error Handling).
Content-Type / Accept header validation: No tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., not application/json) or Accept header handling.

Response schema and content validation: While tests assert a confirmation string/URI, there is no explicit validation that the response body matches the documented type (string) or is a valid URI when expected, or that proper Content-Type is returned.

Idempotency & Duplicate-submission semantics: Duplicate submission is tested for existing planId, but idempotency behavior is not validated (e.g., repeated identical submissions, whether they return the same URI or error code like 409).

HTTP status code granularity for conflicts: The story mentions 400 for invalid/conflicts; tests assume 400 for conflicts. There is no coverage for alternate expected conflict codes (e.g., 409) or verifying precise error codes returned by different implementations.
Audit/logging / header side-effects: No tests verify that X-Killbill-CreatedBy, Reason, Comment are persisted/audited or show up in catalog history.
Rate limiting / Throttling: No tests exercise rate limiting or behavior under rapid repeated requests.
Security: Authorization beyond "missing credentials" (scopes/roles/403) and thorough injection sanitization acceptance tests (beyond returning 400) are not fully covered.
Content negotiation / caching: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or behavior with different Accept headers.
recommendations: Add scenarios that simulate server/database failures and assert HTTP 500 responses and application behavior (retries, idempotency), covering POST Server Error Handling.
Add tests for incorrect or missing Content-Type header (e.g., text/plain, absence of Content-Type) and verify API returns proper 415/400 behavior and rejects non-JSON payloads.

Validate response body schema explicitly: add assertions that the response Content-Type is application/json (if applicable) and that the returned confirmation value is indeed a string and, when expected, a valid URI pattern.

Expand duplicate-submission tests to verify idempotency semantics: repeated identical POSTs should be tested to observe whether they are ignored, return the same resource identifier, or return a specific conflict code (and assert the desired behavior).
Add tests for precise conflict status codes (400 vs 409) and ensure the implementation conforms to the chosen convention in the API contract.
Add tests to verify that audit metadata (X-Killbill-CreatedBy, X-Killbill-Reason, X-Killbill-Comment) are recorded in the catalog history/audit logs and surfaced where applicable.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: flood the endpoint and verify throttling responses (429) or other configured behavior.

Add more in-depth security tests: role-based access checks (403), and sanitization checks that prove dangerous payloads are neutralized (not only a 400 response but also absence of stored executable content).
If the system uses caching or downstream catalog caches, add tests for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) and cache invalidation after new plan creation.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC06, TC30, TC33) validate successful retrieval for default and various query-parameter combinations.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, and audit parameters including combinations, MINIMAL, FULL, NONE, invalid value and empty value tests (TC02–TC06, TC23–TC25, TC27–TC33).
Error Handling: 400 for malformed accountId and invalid parameters (TC09, TC13, TC14, TC23, TC25) and 404 for non-existent accounts/empty DB (TC07, TC08) are covered.
Authorization: Authentication-related negative tests for missing and invalid tokens are present (TC10, TC11).
Security: Injection and XSS inputs are tested to ensure inputs are rejected and no sensitive data is leaked (TC13, TC14).
System & Resilience: Service-unavailable and timeout/retry-related scenarios are covered (TC12, TC16, TC26).
Performance/Load: Large payload and concurrent access tests are included (TC17, TC18).
Edge cases & Regression: Backward compatibility, regression for previously fixed bugs, and many boolean-combination edge cases are present (TC19, TC22, TC31, TC32).
Partial/Dependent Service Degradation: Test for degraded balance service/partial content scenarios is included (TC20).
Accessibility: API documentation accessibility scenario included (TC21) — good for documentation/UI coverage.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests check caching-related headers or behavior (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or validate conditional GET behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit tests for rate limits, 429 responses, or behavior under rapid repeated calls; TC18 (concurrency) is not a substitute for rate-limit tests.
Content-Type and Response Headers: Tests do not assert response Content-Type, relevant headers (e.g., Retry-After on 503), or other contract-level headers.
Response Schema Validation: “Contains Account object” is asserted but there are no explicit schema/field-level validations (required fields, types, formats) for the Account object.
403 / Authorization Scope: Tests cover 401 (unauthenticated) but not 403 (authenticated but forbidden) which may be relevant if RBAC or scoped access applies.
Invalid boolean values: Tests check empty boolean and some combinations, but not malformed boolean values (e.g., accountWithBalance=abc) to ensure proper 400 handling.

Pagination: The standard guideline mentions pagination; while pagination is not typically applicable to a GET by ID endpoint, there is no explicit statement in tests clarifying non-applicability. If API returns related collections (transactions) with paging, there are no pagination tests for those sub-resources.
ETag / Conditional Requests: No tests for conditional GETs (If-None-Match / 304 Not Modified).

Logging / Error Disclosure Assertions: While tests assert that no sensitive data should be leaked in security cases, there are no explicit checks on error message content/verbosity or audit/logging behavior.
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify presence and correctness of Cache-Control and ETag headers, and validate conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match -> 304).

Add rate-limiting tests: simulate rapid repeated calls to confirm 429 behaviour and proper Retry-After headers; include tests that differentiate between throttling and normal concurrency (TC18 remains for correctness under load).
Add response contract/schema validation: verify the Account JSON schema fields, types, and required properties (use JSON schema assertions or contract tests).
Add header and content-type assertions: assert Content-Type: application/json and presence/format of other important headers (Retry-After, X-Request-Id, etc.).
Add forbidden access (403) tests: if RBAC or scope-based access exists, include tests for authenticated-but-forbidden requests.
Expand invalid query parameter tests: include malformed boolean values (e.g., accountWithBalance=abc) and unexpected types for audit to ensure consistent 400 responses.

Clarify pagination applicability: if related collections (transactions, audit items) are returned unpaged, either add pagination support/tests for those sub-resources or document non-applicability in acceptance criteria and test suite.
Add E2E tests for dependent-service failures with explicit expectations (e.g., API returns 206 vs 200 with partial fields) and verify appropriate headers or response flags indicating partial data.
Add assertions on error message content and ensure no sensitive server or stack traces are exposed in error responses.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoices - Retrieve account invoices

covered: Valid Request: Basic successful retrieval for valid account and default behavior (TC01, TC20).
Empty Response: No-invoices and no-match filters return empty JSON arrays (TC08, TC25).

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of startDate/endDate, boolean flags (withMigrationInvoices, unpaidInvoicesOnly, includeVoidedInvoices), audit enum, combinations and partial inputs (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC23, TC24).
Error Scenarios: Invalid accountId format (400) and non-existent account (404) are covered (TC10, TC11).
Authorization: Missing and invalid auth tokens checked (401) (TC12, TC13).
Security / Input Validation: Injection and XSS attempts in query params covered with expected rejection (TC15, TC27).
Non-functional / Resilience: Service unavailable, slow downstream and timeouts considered (503/504) and large-volume performance scenario included (TC14, TC16, TC17).
Concurrency & Regression: Concurrent requests and targeted regression scenarios for unpaidInvoicesOnly and backward compatibility covered (TC18, TC19, TC20).
Edge Cases: startDate after endDate, min/max dates, extremely long accountId handled (TC21, TC22, TC26).
Integration & Documentation: Handling inconsistent downstream data and API documentation accessibility are present (TC28, TC29).
gaps: Pagination: No explicit tests validating pagination mechanics (limit/offset/page tokens), page metadata, or navigation links—TC16 mentions pagination only vaguely.
Caching Behavior: No tests asserting caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GET behavior, or cache invalidation.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limits, 429 responses, or graceful degradation under burst traffic.
Authorization: 403 / role-based access control scenarios are not covered (only 401 unauthenticated cases).
Schema & Content Validation: No strict assertions validating the Invoice object schema, required fields, types, and Content-Type headers.
500 / Internal Server Error: No explicit test simulating server-side failures (500) and recovery/rollback behavior.

Invalid enum/parameter formats: While injection/XSS are covered, there are no tests for invalid enum values (e.g., audit=INVALID) or malformed boolean strings (e.g., unpaidInvoicesOnly=notabool) and their expected 400/422 handling.
Deterministic performance tests: TC16/TC17 contain performance expectations but lack environment-control details and deterministic checks (can be flaky).
Rate-limit + auth interplay: No combined tests for rate-limited authenticated vs unauthenticated requests.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: verify limit/offset (or pageToken) behavior, default page size, max page size, page metadata (totalCount/next/prev), and iterate pages to verify completeness.
Add caching tests: assert presence and correctness of Cache-Control and ETag headers, and test conditional GET (If-None-Match) to validate 304 responses and cache semantics.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts to confirm 429 behavior, Retry-After header usage, and client/backoff guidance.
Add RBAC/403 tests: validate role-based access restrictions (403) and ensure appropriate error messaging for forbidden access.
Add schema validation tests: assert Invoice object fields, types, required properties, and Content-Type (application/json). Include contract tests against the API definition.
Simulate server errors: add tests for 500 Internal Server Error and verify graceful error messages and logging/observability behavior.
Validate parameter parsing & enums: add tests for invalid enum values (audit), malformed booleans, and invalid date formats producing 400/422 with clear messages.

Make non-functional tests deterministic: run performance and timeout tests in controlled environments, assert SLA milestones and document flakiness thresholds; separate load tests from functional suite.

Combine scenarios: add tests that exercise authorization, rate-limiting, and caching together (e.g., repeated authenticated requests to check headers and throttling), and tests asserting Content-Type and response headers consistently.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered: Valid PUT request success (HTTP 204) with DB verification (TC01, TC02).
Header validation: required header missing (X-Killbill-CreatedBy) negative test (TC03) and optional headers presence/combination tests (TC02, TC24).
Path parameter validation: invalid UUID formats for paymentId and paymentTransactionId (TC04, TC05).
Non-existing resources: payment and transaction not found cases (TC06, TC07, TC12).
Request body validation: missing body and malformed JSON (TC09, TC10), and inconsistent/invalid state data (TC08).
Schema/field boundary tests: maximum and minimum field values, extra unsupported fields ignored (TC13, TC14, TC15).
Concurrency and race conditions: concurrent updates to same transaction (TC17).
Resilience and backend errors: slow backend / timeout and degraded dependencies (TC16, TC22).
Authentication negative test (unauthorized/no credentials) (TC11).
Security tests: SQL injection and XSS payload handling (TC18, TC19).
Performance/regression/integration: high-load performance (TC21), regression case (TC20), and integration with degraded service (TC22).

Other robustness tests: extra query params handling (TC25), header whitespace/case tolerance (TC26), mismatched IDs (TC27), partial input (only required fields) behavior (TC23), accessibility of docs (TC28).
gaps: Authorization role enforcement (403 Forbidden) when credentials are valid but lack administrator privileges — no explicit test for authenticated-but-not-admin.
Idempotency / duplicate submissions behavior for PUT (e.g., repeated identical requests should be idempotent) is not explicitly tested.

Explicit assertion about response semantics for HTTP 204: tests do not assert there is no response body and do not verify response Content-Type or other response headers (e.g., application/json presence or absence).

Optimistic locking / version-conflict scenarios (e.g., edit conflicts, ETag/If-Match semantics) and explicit behavior when concurrent conflicting updates occur are not covered — TC17 checks concurrency but not versioning/conflict errors.

Server-side internal failure simulation (explicit 500 Internal Server Error behavior) and how the API surfaces server errors to clients is not covered — only timeouts and degraded services are present.

Clear test for whether partial updates are allowed or rejected according to API contract: TC23 assumes partial allowed but the story/schemas do not fully clarify — no tests for rejecting partial updates when required.

Precise error message content/format validation across all negative scenarios (e.g., standardized error codes, fields like code/message) is only partly asserted; tests mention an error message but do not verify error schema or codes consistently.
Audit/logging side-effects (e.g., verifying X-Killbill-CreatedBy is recorded/audited) are not validated.
recommendations: Add a test for authenticated-but-not-admin users to verify 403 Forbidden and a clear error message describing insufficient privileges.
Add idempotency/duplicate-submission tests: send the same PUT multiple times and assert stable results and idempotent behavior (and document expected behavior in API contract).
Add explicit assertions for HTTP 204 semantics: assert no response body is returned and verify relevant response headers (Content-Type presence/absence, Content-Length, cache-related headers if any).

Introduce optimistic-locking/version-conflict tests: simulate two edits with a version/ETag mechanism (If-Match/If-Unmodified-Since) and assert proper conflict responses (e.g., 409) or other configured behavior.
Add server error simulation tests (500) by injecting DB or service failures to confirm the API returns consistent error responses and that meaningful diagnostics are available to callers.

Clarify and add tests for partial-update contract: if the API should reject partial AdminPayment payloads, add negative tests for missing required fields; if allowed, ensure partial update tests include explicit expectations for fields left unchanged.
Standardize and assert error response schema across negative cases: include assertions for error code, message, and any structured error fields to ensure client reliability.
Add tests to verify audit/logging behavior: ensure X-Killbill-CreatedBy and optional reason/comment are persisted to audit logs or change history as required by policy.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/admin/queues - Get queues entries

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios validate successful retrieval (default and with combinations of accountId, queueName, serviceName, date ranges, and flags).
Empty Response: Scenarios TC11 and TC29 cover behaviour when no data or filters exclude all data.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for valid parameters (accountId, queueName, serviceName, minDate/maxDate, withHistory, withInProcessing, withBusEvents, withNotifications) and combinations (TC10, TC23).

Error Handling: Negative scenarios for invalid accountId format (400), accountId not found (404), malformed date (400), internal server error (500), service unavailable (503), and timeout (504) are present.
Authorization: Unauthorized access test (TC15) checks 401 handling.
Security: Injection (TC17) and XSS (TC26) tests are included to check input sanitization and safe error responses.
Performance/Scale: Large data volume (TC18), concurrent requests (TC20), timeout/recovery (TC19, TC27) are included.
Response Type: Content type assertion for application/octet-stream is explicitly tested (TC01).
Regression & Backwards Compatibility: Regression check for withHistory (TC21) and backward compatibility default flags (TC22) are included.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination/streaming controls (limit/offset/page tokens) or behaviour when result sets are paginated; large-data test expects entire dataset but pagination is not validated.
Caching Behavior: No tests check caching headers or behavior (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET handling.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests validate rate limiting responses (429) or client throttling behaviour; concurrent requests test is present but does not assert throttling behavior.
Authorization nuances: 403 / role-based authorization tests are missing (only 401 is covered).
Response Schema and Content Validation: Tests do not validate the binary/octet-stream payload schema/structure (how to decode/deserialize the octet-stream and assert per-entry fields).
Streaming / Chunking: No tests for correct streaming behavior, partial reads, resume, or chunk boundaries when response is streamed as octet-stream.
Header & Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling, Content-Length, Content-Disposition or how the API behaves with different Accept/Content-Type header combinations.
Edge-case parameter combinations: Missing tests for invalid parameter combinations like minDate > maxDate, contradictory boolean flags, or unexpected boolean formats (e.g., 1/0, TRUE/false).
Rate/Load stability: While large-volume and concurrency are included, there are no sustained load or rate-stability tests (so performance regression risk remains).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: simulate large result sets with limit/offset or page tokens and verify correct paging semantics, next-page tokens, and client consumption of pages.
Validate caching & conditional requests: add tests asserting ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers and conditional GET (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) behavior.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst traffic to assert throttling responses (429) and verify Retry-After headers and client behavior.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 scenarios (valid auth but insufficient permissions), role-based access checks, and token expiry/refresh behavior.
Implement schema-level checks for application/octet-stream payload: decode the stream in tests and assert the per-entry fields, types, and required properties match the API contract.
Test streaming/chunking behavior: verify partial reads, connection interruptions, and resumability (if applicable), and that large streams do not corrupt entries.
Add header & content-negotiation tests: verify responses to different Accept headers and presence/accuracy of Content-Length and Content-Disposition metadata.
Add parameter edge-case tests: minDate > maxDate, boundary dates, boolean value variants, and contradictory filter combinations to assert appropriate 400-level errors or deterministic handling.
Introduce sustained load and stress tests to validate performance and stability over time and detect memory/streaming/resource issues.
